result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathon David Grossen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:30 PM Defendant Jonathon David Grossen in court.  Attorney Philip J. Brehm in court for Jonathon David Grossen.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. DA Nolen presents EX 1; to date - restitution request from the victim. Nolen moved to admit EX 1.  DA Nolen presents EX 2; second restitution request form filled out by the victim. Victim H.J.J sworn in to testify. Victim identifies the defendant. Victim excused from the stand. The Court grants a restitution request. DA Nolen to file order.
State's Brief In Support of Restitution Request.pdf
Defense brief Re: restitution issue

3:00 PM Attorney Philip J. Brehm in court for Jonathon David Grossen.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jonathon David Grossen not in court. Atty Brehm states that the DE was injured at work today. DA Nolen requests the matter be adjourned due to the DE status as well as a new restitution request he just received. Restitution hearing rescheduled.
Restitution hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Restitution hearing on August 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Restitution hearing scheduled for 7/19/22 @ 2:30PM.

Defendant Jonathon David Grossen in court.  Attorney Philip J. Brehm in court for Jonathon David Grossen.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. Court advises defendant of rights.  Elements stated.  Factual basis found. Defendant entered a plea of No Contest. The Victim H.J. makes a statement. The Victim wishes to get restitution in this matter. Restitution hearing scheduled. The Court finds the defendant guilty and orders a JOC be entered with the conditions of withheld sentence and place the defendant on probation for a period of 24 months. Defendant advised of voting rights. Defendant advised of U.S. non-citizen collateral consequences resulting in deportation, the exclusion of admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law. Defendant advised of post conviction relief.
Restitution hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Restitution hearing on July 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Court advises defendant of charges & penalties.  Not Guilty plea entered on count 1 & 2. Bond continues. Matter set over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.
